str2: Of Hebrew origin; Judas, the name of ten Israelites; also of the posterity of one of them and its region.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
The same as Iakob Graecized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as klesis; invited, i.e. Appointed, or, a saint.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
